Health Reform
 

     Preachers should teach health reform, but they should not make it their leading theme.--The health reform is closely connected with the work of the third message, yet it is not the message. Our preachers should teach
72
the health reform, yet they should not make this the leading theme in the place of the message. Its place is among those subjects which set forth the preparatory work to meet the events brought to view by the message; among these it is prominent.--RH May 7, 1914.
